name: places/ChIJYcIH2IBZwokRGRHICyje45I
formattedAddress: 240 E 69th St, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 240 E 69th St, New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text: I have been working with him for one year. He’s a psychiatrist. Our sessions are online and 15 minutes. I have been more stable with the medication that Dr. Maytal provides. Note he is not a psychologist He’s a PHD doctor and oncologist who prescribes medicine. He isn’t a therapist. Therefore our sessions are very brief, short and direct. I see a weekly therapist for venting.

text.text: I have been working with him for one year. He’s a psychiatrist. Our sessions are online and 15 minutes. I have been more stable with the medication that Dr. Maytal provides. Note he is not a psychologist He’s a PHD doctor and oncologist who prescribes medicine. He isn’t a therapist. Therefore our sessions are very brief, short and direct. I see a weekly therapist for venting.

originalText.text: My brief appointment with Dr. Maytal was most regrettable.  I immediately felt  his manner to be arrogant and dismissive, and he appeared to be totally disinterested in my responses to his litany of generic, impersonal questions — all of which  could have been answered by an on-line questionnaire.  I found  his infrequent comments to be antagonistic and void of any concern or compassion, particularly  knowing that I had been treated for breast cancer.

text.text: My brief appointment with Dr. Maytal was most regrettable.  I immediately felt  his manner to be arrogant and dismissive, and he appeared to be totally disinterested in my responses to his litany of generic, impersonal questions — all of which  could have been answered by an on-line questionnaire.  I found  his infrequent comments to be antagonistic and void of any concern or compassion, particularly  knowing that I had been treated for breast cancer.

originalText.text: I found him cold and dismissive. At one point I raised an issue about medication versus personality and he said “that’s not a question I am interested in.” I felt horrible the entire time I was talking with him. I did not follow his advice as I did not trust it. So I essentially threw out $600 even as I was hoping for some help. Really horrible experience.

text.text: I found him cold and dismissive. originalText.text: Fine for medication dispensing, but extremely full of himself and often condescending. Gets easily exasperated with patient follow ups and slow to respond.

text.text: Fine for medication dispensing, but extremely full of himself and often condescending. Gets easily exasperated with patient follow ups and slow to respond.

originalText.text: I had a similar experience to the other reviewer. I’m seriously confused as to why he’s doing this job. He’s outwardly judgmental about everything which is  extremely inappropriate for a psychiatrist. He makes me very uncomfortable. Most importantly, he handled an emergency situation, an adverse reaction to medication, with exasperation and anger. He gave hasty, very dangerous instructions for medication and never followed up to make sure everything is ok.
